title: Advanced Multivariable Calculus Enrichment Course Using Blended Learning: Strengthening Mathematical Representation and Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of calculus and linear algebra, logical reasoning skills for mathematical problem-solving, and basic proof-writing abilities
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining mobile apps and LMS in a bring-your-own-device (BYOD) environment. Project-based assessments reinforce real-world problem-solving skills. Learners write reports using precise mathematical terminology and symbols, improving expressive and reading comprehension skills through peer feedback.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately compute partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and line integrals of multivariable functions and apply mathematical expressions to solve physics problems.
Learners can solve physics problems using vector field concepts, Stokes’ Theorem, and the Divergence Theorem and explain the logical structure of mathematical proofs.

Learners can apply three self-directed learning strategies (time management, resource evaluation, feedback utilization) in a blended learning environment for 6 months, analyze over five mathematical learning materials, conduct two or more real-time collaborative sessions (60+ minutes each) with team members via Google Workspace or Notion, and describe three or more mathematical expressions (e.g., equations, graphs, proofs) and problem-solving processes in a final team project report (5–7 pages) according to rubric criteria (80% clarity, 80% logical coherence).

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Real-Time Whiteboard, Documentation System)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
